subject: Leadership
title: Formal vs. Informal Leadership
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Formal vs. Informal Leadership.

hook.text: The CEO has a title. But the person everyone actually goes to for advice? She's an intern.

buildup.text: Formal leaders have authority from titles and positions. Informal leaders earn influence through trust and expertise.

discovery.text: Research shows informal leaders often shape culture more than formal ones because people follow them by choice.

twist.text: Organizations that ignore informal leaders miss their most powerful assetâ€”and sometimes their biggest risk.

climax.text: Smart formal leaders identify and empower informal ones. Together, they move organizations faster than either alone.

punchline.text: A title makes you a boss. Trust makes you a leader.

quiz.question: What gives informal leaders their influence?
